trip.summ: 5 days, 34 miles, many, many feet down & up
trip.introDescr: In January, 2012, my friends, Nick and Jonas, invited newbies, Kelly and I, to take a 5 day hike down into the Grand Canyon.  We went down the Tanner Trail and spent three nights along the river and then a long hike up the Hance Creek Trail to Horseshoe Mesa.  The final push in the early morning was up to Grandview Point.  By the end we had gotten a great GC education
trip.introPic1span: From Lipan Pt straight down to river

adventureDay.h3: It’s a 4,600-foot, knee-buckling descent to the Colorado River over 9 miles
adventureDay.pdesc: We spent the first night at a campground on the rim, where I learned that Arizona is not as warm as you think it is – a lesson that would be further emphasized upon entering the Canyon.  The next morning we woke up, scrambled around REI buying stuff we’d forgot, bummed some coffee from a hotel to make up for a night spent shivering instead of sleeping, and drove to the trailhead. We dropped in at a place called Lipan Point, about 9 miles south of where the Little Colorado meets the big.
adventureDay.mapspan: We hiked thru snow for the first hour

pictures.piccap: Nick and Jonas had a much better idea where we were heading.
By noon on the second day we would be well past those flats

adventureDay.h1title: A no-pack day up the river
adventureDay.pdesc: Day 2 was a “rest day” in that we hiked without packs. In was not so much a rest day in that we set an insane goal of hiking to Little Colorado confluence and back (about 18 miles) by early afternoon.   We made it about half way.  Upon return we found the crows were much smarter than anticipated and kevlar bags are not always the answer.  We continued down the river a few more miles and made camp along the river.
adventureDay.mapspan: We were hiking up the river and got past the flats on the left.

pictures.piccap: This was our lunch break prior to heading back down the river
Our tarp wouldn't look so good in the morning

adventureDay.h1title: Into slot canyons and back up onto the Tonto Trail
adventureDay.pdesc: After a night of rain we were going up the The Papago Wall which rises about 35 feet.  From there we had some long traverses along the Tonto Trail,  We ended the day for our third night on the river with great sunsets down the canyon

pictures.piccap: Looking out over the Unkar Creek
We climbed down in 75 mile creek slot canyon

adventureDay.h1title: A long hard hike up to Horseshoe Mesa
adventureDay.h3: Leave the river and go up
adventureDay.pdesc: Day four was our 'going up' day. This was a long day with some long stretches of switchbacks to get us up onto Horse Mesa and our camping spot.  It was pretty cold and we put on most of our warm clothes for the night.

pictures.piccap: Starting our day along the river.
Nick, Jim, Kelly and Jonah on top of Horseshoe Mesa

adventureDay.h1title: Up early and hiking out by 9am
adventureDay.h3: We left before sunup and walked the first hour in the dark

pictures.piccap: Back into the snow at 6,500 feet
Amazing morning from on top at aptly named Grandview Point

adventureDay.smugAlbumName: Walking out and back to the snow
